FuncDef:
The mld snooping require-router-alert command configures interfaces in a VLAN to discard MLD messages that do not carry the Router-Alert option in IP headers.
The undo mld snooping require-router-alert command restores the default configuration. The mld snooping require-router-alert command configures interfaces in a VLAN to discard MLD messages that do not carry the Router-Alert option in IP headers. The undo mld snooping require-router-alert command restores the default configuration. By default, the MLD messages accepted by a device from a VLAN do not need to carry the Router Alert option. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
